Value Statement:

As a BIP-AI MLOps engineer who maintains infrastructure for knowledge base creation, I need the ability to ensure that OpenSearch indices are created with the correct embedding size so that knowledge base creation does not fail due to mismatched model configurations.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When a user initiates knowledge base creation, the system creates the OpenSearch index with the embedding size aligned to the currently configured Titan model.
- The mismatch between embedding size and model configuration is resolved to prevent index creation failure.

items.from_string: Fix embedding size mismatch during OpenSearch index creation for knowledge base setup
items.to_string: Create new SCC knowledge base with new chunking strategy

As a BIP AI team member who manages CI/CD pipelines, I need to create a new image builder pipeline in the Harness mgmt instance, based on the existing repo definition from Harness sbx, so that container images can be built and maintained centrally with the correct configuration.

When the pipeline is created in Harness mgmt, it uses the existing repo definition as a reference.
When implemented, the new pipeline contains the necessary modifications for compatibility with the mgmt environment.
When triggered, the new pipeline successfully builds and pushes container images without errors.
When configured, the pipeline uses mgmt secrets, connectors, and service accounts.

As an BIP-AI member, I need a new prototype a custom Crossplane Provider for Bedrock Knowledge Bases. There are no readily available solutions that works for us, therefore the need to build it ourselves.
 * Ensure prototype works with the Crossplane runtime.
 *  Ensure provider communicates with AWS SDK with to CRUD for Bedrock Knowledge Bases. 
 * Ensure provider works with our current infrastructure setup.

As a BIP AI team member who manages pipeline reliability, I need to integrate new service accounts into the healthcheck pipeline so that the pipeline run with the correct credentials.

When the pipeline runs, it uses the new service accounts for all required checks without failures.
When credentials are rotated or updated, the pipeline continues to function with the updated accounts.
This issue is cloned by BIP-28248

items.from_string: Integrate new service accounts into healthcheck pipeline so that the pipeline run with the correct credentials
items.to_string: Integrate new service accounts into healthcheck pipeline
This issue is cloned by BIP-28867

items.from_id: Service account issues have been resolved, approved to be done from dev to preprod.

items.to_string:
As a BIP AI team member who contributes to pipeline development, I need a standardized Harness PR template with a GitHub Copilot prompt so that pull requests follow a consistent structure and developers can auto-generate key sections of the PR for faster, clearer submissions.

When the template is used, it includes fields for description, acceptance criteria, testing evidence, and related tickets.
When reviewers view PRs, they see consistent formatting across all Harness-related submissions.
When developers use GitHub Copilot, a pre-defined prompt guides them to auto-fill the PR template with meaningful content (e.g., pipeline name, changes made, testing performed).

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who wants to use the new Sagemaker feature, I need the ability to enable SageMaker Scheuler so that it can be used to schedule pipelines for tenants.

Acceptance Criteria
When a SM pipeline is created, the scheduler feature should be able to be used through the SageMaker UI and through the notebook. Verify that the pipeline ran and test that it is able to be scheduled at specific times without failing.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains shared tools, I need to create a new mlkit release in the repo, verify Jenkins pipelines execute successfully in each environment, and update the lifecycle configuration so that tenants can reliably use the latest version.

Acceptance Criteria

A new mlkit release is created in the repo.
Jenkins pipelines execute successfully in each environment and publish the new version.
The new mlkit version is available in all supported environments.
The lifecycle configuration (LCC) is updated to reference the new version.

Value Statement:  As a BIP AI Tenant who manages prompts in Bedrock I need the ability to create and manage Bedrock prompt templates for the Analysis Agent and Research Agent so that the agents’ reasoning logic is centralized, version-controlled, and easily auditable

Acceptance Criteria:
The Bedrock prompt management includes prompts used in the Verifiaction Agents workflow with configured ARNs, versions/variants and tags. The prompts templates have been tested and produce the expected output.

Assumptions:
IAM permissions for Bedrock Prompt Management are available in the target AWS environment.

items.from_string: Build Bedrock Prompt Library so that the agentsâ€™ reasoning logic is centralized, version-controlled, and easily auditable

As a MLOps engineer who maintains development environments for SageMaker,  I need to fix the LCCs so that there is one unified script that only uses S3` script 

Acceptance Criteria

When a Tenant uses SageMaker and  utilizes the LCC to start up their environment, it should be simple and default. 
It will also setup the LCC to only use a script stored in S3 (editable) to not make any new versions of the LCC.

As an MLE enabling frontend engineers to adopt Figma MCP, I want to deliver a clear and polished demo video that walks through setup, usage, and results so that viewers can quickly understand how to integrate and benefit from the MCP workflow.

AC: Final video is exported in a shareable format and stored in the MFE Archetype repo.
Integrate Playwright MCP Starter Repo With Test Automation Team for VBMS

Value Statement

As a developer who will leverage Playwright MCP, I would like to work with the Test Automation team to integrate VBMS based tests using the new Playwright MCP starter repo created by BIP AI.

Acceptance Criteria

Successfully work with test automation team to integrate VBMS testing using the new Playwright MCP starter repo.

As an MLE who is creating Bedrock agents using MCPs, I want to create an automate way to define the OpenAPI schema, so bedrock agent creation can be accelerated.

AC: Function created in notebook that can automatically infer the schema from an mcp and upload it to a lambda function action group.

As an MLE building MCP deployments, I want to finalize the AWS Documentation MCP server setup and supporting resources s that it can be reliably queried and demonstrated as a reference implementation for future MCP work.

AC: Sagemaker notebook expanded beyond tool-listing to demonstrate at least one successful query/response against AWS docs. Notebook instructions include clear usage steps (connect, query, interpret response)

**Value Statement:**

As an BIP-AI member, I need a new EntraID Group created for the RBAC Saga to properly manage access control and permissions for BIP infrastructure components.

- Track a new EntraID Group from VA, which will form the basis for cluster permissions for the infra team. Follow the established naming convention and be integrated with the existing RBAC framework for BIP infrastructure.
- When the EntraID Group are provisioned, more work will be done to integrate teh EntraID group in following stories.

items.from_string:
**Story:**
As a frontend developer working on the BIP AI platform, I need to modularize the All Resources view Vue.js components by extracting reusable functionality into separate components to improve code maintainability, enable component reuse across the application, and reduce the complexity of the main view.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Extract the main data table component into a separate reusable Vue file
- Modularize the pause functionality component for standalone use
- Extract the deep pause feature into its own component
- Create a separate component for the hard refresh functionality
- Modularize all modal components used in the All Resources view
- Extract any other reusable UI elements or utility functions into separate components
- Ensure all extracted components maintain their current functionality and behavior
- Update the All Resources view to import and use the new modular components
- Implement proper props and events communication between parent and child components
- Add appropriate component documentation and prop validation
- Maintain all existing CSS styling and responsive behavior

**Definition of Done:**
- All Resources view file length significantly reduced while maintaining full functionality
- Each extractable feature exists as an independent Vue component in separate files
- All modular components properly tested and validated in SBX environment
- No functionality lost during the modularization process
- Component props and events properly defined with TypeScript interfaces where applicable
- All new components follow Vue.js and project coding standards
- Pull request created with clear description of modularization changes
- Code review completed by team members with approval
- Pull request successfully merged to main branch
- SBX testing confirms all features work as expected post-modularization
items.to_string:
Title: Troubleshoot Bedrock Agent and Knowledge Base compositions to enable reliable provisioning via IaC for future self-service


Story: As an application developer, I want to troubleshoot and fix the existing Crossplane compositions for Bedrock Agents and Knowledge Bases so that I can reliably provision AI infrastructure through predefined claim templates without encountering permission issues or provisioning failures.
 * Identify root causes of current permission issues preventing Bedrock Agent provisioning
 * Identify root causes of provisioning failures in Bedrock Knowledge Base compositions
 * Document all discovered blockers and their impact on the infrastructure provisioning process
 * Evaluate whether blockers can be resolved within current provider and Terraform module version constraints
 * For resolvable issues, implement fixes to the Crossplane compositions
 * For unresolvable issues, identify and document alternative approaches or workarounds
 * Validate that fixed compositions successfully provision Bedrock Agents through claim templates
 * Validate that fixed compositions successfully provision Bedrock Knowledge Bases through claim templates
 * Ensure all modifications maintain compatibility with existing platform constraints

Definition of Done:
 * All current blockers are identified and documented with root cause analysis
Decision matrix created showing which issues can be resolved vs require alternatives
 * Bedrock Agent composition is either fixed and functional or alternative solution is documented
 * Bedrock Knowledge Base composition is either fixed and functional or alternative solution is documented
 * Updated compositions pass validation testing in development environment
 * Application developers can successfully create Bedrock Agents using predefined claim templates
 * Application developers can successfully create Bedrock Knowledge Bases using predefined claim templates
 * Documentation updated to reflect any changes or known limitations
 * Code changes are reviewed and merged to main branch

items.to_string:
Value Statement
As an SE supporting the SPA team during a major model pivot, I need the ability to invoke Jenkins pipelines from their new deploy script so that SPA can deploy endpoints and test across environments, ensuring we hit the deadline while the long-term solution is developed in parallel.


Acceptance Criteria
Jenkins and SageMaker Notebook runs are isolated: Jenkins runs can overwrite an endpoint of the same name, but notebook mode cannot; a flag must be created to differentiate modes.


Tests (e.g., black, pylint, coverage) are included in Jenkins runs
Security groups are pulled in as environment variables, not from config.yaml
SPA changes are merged into the Jenkins integration branch
Pipeline/scripts adapt to SPA changes without breaking deployments
Flask app can successfully establish connections with deployed endpoints in tested environments
Assumptions
This is a temporary/bridge solution to meet the model-pivot deadline.
The SPA team will continue using their deploy script during this interim period.

Dependencies
SPA team will be modifying scripts that must be adapted to as this ticket is worked on.
BIP-25959 Support Development of Smart Pension Automation Use Case

items.from_string:
Value Statement
As a SE who supports SPA, I need the ability to update the PROD deployment  pipeline to work w/ their new model so that we can hit the prod shadow deployment window.

Acceptance Criteria
When a user triggers the prod deployment pipeline the user has the ability to deploy an endpoint successfully to prod based on SPA's new model.
items.to_string:
As a SE who supports SPA, I need the ability to create a lambda function based on their inference script since the model is no longer a traditional ML model. We will need to serve it via API gateway instead of a sagemaker endpoint

Acceptance Criteria
When a user invokes the lambda function, the user has the ability to receive a response from the new SPA model
